oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Crayon print of James Coleman Adkins and wife Harriet E. Burnett Adkins
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: James Coleman Adkins served in Co. H, 38th Va. Inf. Regt., CSA. According to his pension application he was wounded at Antietam, Md. in September 1862 and again at Gettysburg, Penn. in July 1863. The 38th Va. lost 55% of the men engaged at Gettysburg.; In 1867, James Coleman Adkins married Harriet E. Burnett and soon thereafter moved to Palmersville, Weakley County, Tennessee. Harriet died sometime before 1903 and James died in 1919. Both are buried in the Thompson Cemetery in Weakley County, Tennessee.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Adkins, James Coleman;Adkins, Harriet E. Burnett
